I normally don't give positive reviews to games I think require additional work to enjoy, such as patching or modding, but with this game I am making an exception.

Sonic Adventure is still one of the most fun games ever made and it's a shame the 2003 version, Sonic Adventure DX: Director's Cut, is the only version available on contemporary platforms because it is an extreme downgrade on many different levels.

Thankfully there's the Dreamcast Converstion mod, which can be installed by acquiring the basic Sonic Adventure Mod Installer. It restores the game as it was in 1999, with full widescreen support and bug fixes included, turning it from the worst version of the game to the absolute best version.

185746240.review:
There is a lot of rhetoric around whether Sonic games have held up over the years, and I generally fall in the camp of saying they do not.  However, with Sonic Adventure 1 specifically, there is some nuance to understanding its game design that can easily change perspectives from it being a broken, abysmal mess to it being one of the best arcade based platformers ever created.  Unfortunately, a lot of this nuance can fly over over the heads of many, including sonic fans, so I'd like to clear the air a bit and explain why I genuinely think sonic adenture 1 holds up where adventure 2 does not.

Firstly, let's talk about what didn't hold up so well.

1.) For starters, I DO NOT think SA1 is a good adventure based game.  Its hub world, explorable environments and mini objectives to unlock levels are at times interesting and immersive, but ultimately do not add as much to the game as nostalgia made us think.  Most of it is fluff and frankly just time waster fetch quests.  

2.) the bosses are terrible and simply bad design.  Banal at best and frustrating at worst, they don't hold up on multiple play throughs at all.  The last boss especially is terrible.  

3.) collision detection as per usual with sonic games can be very buggy, leading to frustrating deaths and weird physics interactions.

4.) accessory gameplay types such as kart racing, on rails shooting segments, pinball etc. are also just ways to pad the game and are pretty horribly executed; not worth replaying once you've beaten the campaign.  

-------------------
So what does hold up?  

1.) granularity.  The spin dash design stands out in the series and in games in general, and it takes a bit of keen dissection to appreciate its design.  Essentially, the spin dash in SA1 allows you a fine degree of granularity of speed control based on how you use it; you can do an instant spin dash to move very slow as a way to instantly start momentum but have very fine control of your movement.  Then, if you hold down spin dash longer, you can go much faster.  But it doesn't end there, everyone knows that!  Unlike SA2, you also can mash spin dash for an intense amount of speed, and you can mash it in whatever rhythm suits your needs in the current moment, allowing a fine degree of control.  It also doesn't stop there!  You can cancel spin dashes to chain them to mash spin dash even faster by using an extra input, letting you mash spin dash as fast as your fingers can go, allowing an insane amount of speed.  But don't worry, you can completely go from any speed you're currently going to a complete dead stop by jump then canceling the jump with the cancel button, stopping you dead in your tracks, letting you then continue right into your next desirable action.  You also can charge a spin dash into a spin dash to do a kind of "super jump" which is a great tool to allow even more flexibility.  All of these granular options combine together to allow an unprecedented amount of control that rewards mastery, skill and practice.  It allows you to go at your current pace and understanding of the levels...Despite the immense skill ceiling, you can use the granularity of options to not need to try and go faster than your skill level, while letting you push yourself at any given moment to try to push your skill.  

2.) level design.  While occasionally frustrating at first, as you gain finer control of the movement options, you begin to appreciate the thorny aspect of the level design.  Some levels allow noobs to spam spin dash comfortably, while others disrupt the flow a lot, forcing players to become more comfortable with the expressive and dynamic nature of the movement and physics.  Some levels will coax you to develop your spin dash jump skill for example to skip tedious/slow parts of levels, which you then take with you as you hone your mastery in all levels.  Essentially, the levels do a good job at mixing the right amount of flow and obstacles to help develop your understanding of the physics and it works really well and opens the game to a greater amount of replayability and depth.  

3.) functional arcade design.  Luckily, after beating the adventure mode, you can just skip right to time trial mode and see the game more as a pure arcade game, and that's really how the game should be seen first and foremost; as a 3D adaptation of classic 2D sonic games.  In this perspective, the game really does hold up a lot better than adventure 2, due to the above 2 paragraphs.  Every arcade game worth their salt knows how to add in the right "thorns" into the design that push the players into greater mastery of its skill based systems, and in this regard, adventure 1 does a lot better of a job, where in comparison, adventure 2 while perhaps more initially "intuitive", ends up falling flat gameplay wise and more frustrating due to the lack of finer control and skill expression.

4.) aesthetics.  First, go to the mods section and download better SADX, turn off V-sync (lower input lag), and install the dreamcast version, restoring the aesthetics to the superior dreamcast version.  The use of colors and art style in the DC version still hold up very well, and in the end I'd say more artistic and timeless than SA2.  You can genuinely feel the heart put into the game by its original artists in the DC version and the genuine passion of the environments, music (perhaps one of the best OSTs of all time) and atmosphere come together in a way that feels authentic and from the heart as opposed to the more commercial feel of SA2.
-------------------------

Overall, despite its typical sonic quirks, SA1 DOES hold up, but not for reasons I'd say are conventional in the current rhetoric surrounding the game.  While it is true that the "adventure" elements does allow it to be more immersive at times than SA2, ultimately its the gameplay design that makes it so special, and it is a shame that this kind of degree of skill expression and control hasn't ever been attempted again after it.  It is here in my opinion where old age SEGA truly deserved to be recognized as one of the greatest devs in history, from games like crazy taxi, virtua fighter 5, f zero GX, spikeout and sonic adventure 1 that were games understood the importance of arcade game design as an art form.  Games that were meant to be played over and over again; games that made you want to master them, games that allowed you to express yourself in terms of gameplay in ways that games simply don't offer today due to a reliance on streamlining systems and level design and removing all the "thorns" to make a game that plays as smooth as possible, while not remembering that it was game design like this that truly allowed for the smoothest yet deepest gameplay as long as you can stomach that it respects your capacity to learn, adapt and overcome hurdles along the way.

185725351.review:
Sonic Adventure was one of those "Mythical" games that I had for my laptop back in like 2007 on a disk. I played the WHOLE thing on Keyboard since I didn't understand that a controller was even an OPTION. I was 7 years old at the time and didn't know better. I loved it. 

I used to even run around in the Adventure Field and play the game like I was playing with toys at home. Making up stories and such. The old Sonic Shorts animations on YT helped a lot in that regard xD

Regardless, SA1 was a big part of my childhood, so you may think I'm nostalgia blind. Trust me, I am not. As a kid I HATED the Amy, Big and Gamma sections because they were not fast. Now as an adult, they are REALLY not that bad.

The story of SA1 is simple ENOUGH, yet expanded from the classics, adding in deeper lore with the chaos emeralds and the Echidna's. But it is MORE than understandable from just playing Sonic's story.

The gameplay holds up INCREDIBLY well. All characters feel smooth and precise to control. I will say it, WAY BETTER than Mario 64 who "had a better transition to 3D" Screw you, Sonic's first mainline game in 3D rocks. The only gripe with the gameplay is the camera. You will find yourself fighting the camera SO often, especially when you get better at the game and stop following the path the devs programmed the camera to follow. It WILL kill you when trying to make jumps the game didn't expect you to make/wasn't coded into the first playthrough experience. Yes, Big's, Amy's and Gamma's stories are slower, and less "Sonic-y", but they still hold up. Amy is ADORABLE, think of her as the "Hard mode" if you need to. And Big... Ugh, it's boring and stupid but once you know how the fishing works it is easy peasy.

I would highly recomend modding the game to use the "Better Sonic Adventure" mod, as it adds back in the original character models, textures and lighting, which the DX version ruined, as well as some other minor fixes.

Pros:
-Fun and simple story
-Controls that modern Sonic games STILL can't emulate.
-Tons of charm and FANTASTIC music (obviously, it's Sonic)

Cons:
-Awkward camera
-Lots of jank and little bugs that you notice the more you play
-Not the greatest voice acting

185699642.review:
Sonic games as a franchise is something that despite having known about them for a long time, I never actually got to experience many of them myself. Especially the mainline titles. So now that I have both played and 100%'ed Sonic Adventure DX, I can sufficiently say that I had been kind of missing out.

Overall, the game is a good, albeit slightly janky and aged experience. Mods can definitely help the experience too however. Completing the game and the main experience is a fun one, but 100%'ing it is a different story.

While it was fun to finish the game and all its characters' stories, however janky their gameplay or goofy their voice lines were, trying to get all the achievements wasn't so fun. The 3 level systems is rather redundant, the Chao garden stuff takes alot of time to come into fruition, and the worst of all, the missions.

Oh my god, the missions suck so much. I did not enjoy playing those at all, and I only managed to complete all of them by chance. Definitely avoid those, unless you're trying to also get all of the achievements. 

I held off writing this review to see if how I'd feel about the game after getting every achievement, and I'd say if you're gonna just play the game casually, maybe complete the main story and do some Chao garden stuff, it's a solid 8/10.

But if you're trying to 100% the game, then it's a 6/10 I'd say. Hopefully Sonic Adventure 2 will not prove to be as annoying in this regard.

Compared to Dreamcast version this version of the Sonic Adventure is terrible.

Graphics are downgraded:
A lot of reflections are missing.
Most or maybe all of lighting effects are missing.
A lot of particle effects are missing.
Most of the textures are replaced with textures that look worse or out of place and break overall uniformity of the games look.
Transparency also don't look right.


there are also a lot of sound issues.
In cut scenes most of the sound effects are missing.
Sound mixing is broken a lot of times you can't hear what characters are talking.

Some enemy behavior are broken for example turrets don't shoot at sonic in flying stage.

Game feels unfinished and unpolished which is not the case with Dreamcast version.

僕がこのゲームを初めてDC版でプレイした時の感想は
[b] なんて直線的な動きを強制されて詰まらないゲームなんだ [/b]
でした

しかしある時、動画でこのゲームのタイムアタックを見た時に驚愕
レールの上を走るだけの様なゲームと思っていたものが実は自由度が高い上に様々なテクニックの嵐、それらがゲーム性を豊かにしており初めてモダンソニックの魅力に気づかされました
壁抜けとかそういうテクニックが多いのは事実ですが、そういうインチキじみたものではなく純粋にゲーム性が高いテクニックが沢山あります

そんな本作ですが、それでも[u] 購入に際し絶対に注意しておいて頂きたい注意点 [/u]があります
このゲームの肝は明らかにタイムアタックです
クリア後好きなステージでタイムアタック出来ますがそこに至るまでに初心者は大変な苦労を強いられます
アクションステージをプレイする為にはアドベンチャーモード(街などのマップを自由に移動する)でステージ入口を探したり鍵を探したりしないといけないのですがこれが大変
尋常じゃないほど導線が弱く、本当に次にどこに行けばよいかわからず、更にアドベンチャーモードには致命的な欠陥があります
普段3D酔いしない僕でも気分が悪くなる、悪魔的なカメラワークの悪さです
このゲームのカメラワークの特徴は、プレイヤーが上手く操作した場合にのみ気持ちよくカメラが移動する、というものになっています
前述の導線の弱さ、最悪のカメラワーク、そもそもゲームの言わば導入部でしかないアドベンチャーモードに長時間拘束され画面酔いに襲われるという地獄…
実はこのゲームの複数あるアドベンチャー用のマップなんてどれも広いものじゃないんです
だから次にやるべき事と移動すべき場所を理解してさえいれば合間合間のアドベンチャーモードは直ぐに終わります
でも出来ない、攻略動画でも見ない限り円滑に進めるのはまず無理
ほんとーーーに苦しい目に遭わされました
攻略サイト様で文章での攻略手順紹介を違うモニターに映しながらプレイしましたが、それでも迷う、本当にそのレベルで導線が悪い
なのでゲームで画面酔いを体験して苦しい目にあった事のある方は、その時々のアドベンチャーモードの攻略動画を試聴してからアクションステージに入るというプレイを強くお勧めします

以上お勧めしているのかお勧めしていないのかわからないようなレビューになってしまいましたが、アクションステージだけを自由にプレイ出来るようになると「楽しさ」「面白さ」「気持ちよさ」3拍子揃った最高のゲームに変貌します

185316442.review:
3.5/5 Great game
I played with mods so that I could get the original sega saturn experience which made the game look pretty nice. I recommend you also get the mods as it makes the models look nicer. The game is decent, but very frustrating especially when getting 100%. 

[b]Story:[/b] The story is pretty decent, its a sonic game so I obviously don't expect anything groundbreaking, but it was enjoyable and I liked some of the characters like Amy and Knuckles.

[b]Gameplay & controls:[/b] The game suffers from early 3D game physics where you can get stuck on a lot and mess with it a lot. A couple things are a bit BS like the Big the cat fishing segments which are very annoying to play.

[b]Visual design:[/b] I kind of love the way the game looks, its all low poly which is obviously how the game looked when it originally released and I like it as that. Character designs and location designs are really cool.

[b]Music and SFX:[/b] I actually like the music a lot of it is memorable and catchy and most of the time I wasnt getting annoyed at it for being too repetitive.

[b]Achievements:[/b] Really long and frustrating to get 100% in. Especially with a couple of the missions, the chao garden and fishing with big.

[b]Enjoyment:[/b] I enjoyed the main game, once you leave it you delve into really annoying game design.

[b]Bugs & Other problems:[/b] My biggest issue is how awful the camera is and the physics are awful as well. The camera gets stuck on literally everything and chooses the worst positions. Going free camera doesn't help either because the camera will still get stuck on literally everything. I hate the layouts of Twinkle park and Lost city.

Overall, pretty decent game if you are a sonic fan it is a must to play. The PC port is decent, but you should install mods for a better experience. Also the chaos are ADORABLE.

I think the Sonic stages are by far the best part of the game. Sonic's spin dash is really overpowered in this game allowing for a lot of speed and launching Sonic off of objects. Tails' stages are alright too, featuring races against Sonic and an Egg Man final boss. 

Gamma's story is one of the best Sonic stories but the gameplay side is whatever. Amy's levels are ok, she is like the opposite of Sonic being really slow and more platforming focused. 

Big's fishing sections are not really fun because fishing doesn't really fit the Sonic series IMO.

Sonic Adventure allows you to pick which character you want to play instead of how its done in SA2 where you have to play through every characters stage.

I'd recommend installing this if you plan on playing the game: https://gitlab.com/PiKeyAr/sadx-mod-installer/-/wikis/home
It makes the game more like how it originally was on the Dreamcast while fixing many bugs and glitches that were created when porting the game to the GameCube and then to the PC..

185111779.review: Despite it's age, Sonic Adventure still manages to be an absolute delight to play. While there is some jank, none of the characters feel too bad to play and the main star, Sonic, holds up pretty good to today's standards. The diversity between the characters and their missions makes it easy not to tired of the game and offers good replay value. The plot is pretty interesting with each character telling their version of the story and leads to a climatic ending. I can't deny that the game has it's flaws. There are some glitches that may cause frustration, but thankfully they are easy to avoid and, at least in my experience, not too common. Some of the character's dialogue can be a bit dated and cutscenes can feel a bit weird at times. However, the actual gameplay and plot makes up for the games flaws and more. If you're a fan of Sonic and haven't played this game, do yourself a flavour and pick up this wonderful game

I played this game tons as a kid, and recently discovered it on Steam during the Winter Sale.

To put it nicely, this game did not age well. However, if kid me didn’t care, then adult me is able to overlook the awkward voice work, glitches and bugs to experience that nostalgia! (Screw the Big the Cat levels though, those fishing games for the B and A emblems are awful!)

If you’re like me and didn’t play the Dreamcast version, the DX port really messed up textures, colours, and introduced bugs to the game. I recommend looking up the SA Mod Manager and finding a few mods to help restore the game to its Dreamcast glory! Trust me, it will make your experience better.

I recommend this game for the hardcore fans, but casual fans or anyone wanting to experience Sonic games will get a kick out of this one!

184827300.review:
Легенда игропрома, недооценённый грааль сеги дримкаст, одна из лучших игр 90ых в принципе и мой любимый соник.
Вам предстоит пройти полноценную историю, закрученную вокруг целых шести игровых персонажей. Каждый из них обладает если не собственным геймплеем, то собственной игровой целью на уровне. отличающей его от других.
Уровни красочны и динамичны, история ненапряжная, отчего при желании игрока он может следить за ней и подводными камнями лора, а может этого и не делать. В любом случае финал одиссеи порадует)).
В целом это приключение на 6-8 или даже 10 часов, которое не оставляет искушённого игрок в стороне, оставляя за собой вечную память о былых временах.

184816213.review:
Primeiramente para melhor experienciar baixe SADX Mod, sua instalação é muito simples e todos os mods necessários já vem instalados.

Com isso em mente, eu tive uma ótima experiência nesse jogo, ele é super divertido e as campanhas com vários personagens diferentes completam muita na experiência, faz com o que o jogo seja bem diverso e evita repetição.

Outra coisa que eu amei também foi a estética do jogo, super colorido com cores super vivas, cada fase com um design mais bonito que o outro. O auge da estética do Dreamcast que infelizmente não é muito presente hoje em dia mesmo com a popularidade atual do jogos com gráficos low poly.

O jogo porém tem alguns pontos negativos: a câmera é muito ruim e desorientadora, esse fator atrapalha muito ao controlar principalmente o Sonic, já que muitas vezes ela te impede de ser tão veloz quanto você queria. E o jogo não tem desculpa para ser assim, uma vez que Mario 64 tinha lançado anteriormente e com uma câmera perfeita para jogos plataforma 3D.

A história também é meio meh, um pouco jogada e não fazendo sentido em muitos momentos.

Apesar desses pontos negativos, ainda vale muito a pena jogar Sonic Adventure hoje em dia graças a sua cativante e divertida gameplay(levando o mod em conta).

Meu único adendo seria de que o jogo não vale a pena a preço cheio, espere uma promoção que já está muito bem pago.

184453707.review:
[h3] TL;DR en fin de critique [/h3]

Bon, je vais surement me faire lyncher pour ça mais écoutez moi attentivement.
Sonic Adventure 1 à objectivement super mal vieilli.

Et je vais m'expliquer, et expliquer pourquoi le jeu m'a déplu... 
(Et avant de commencer à m'insulter, lisez ma critique en entière... Et si vous ne comprenez toujours pas mon avis après avoir pris le temps de comprendre mon avis, je suis entièrement à disposition à parler calmement de tout ça en commentaire...)


[h1] Sonic Adventure était un super jeu [/h1]
Les musiques, l'histoire, le level design... Toutes ces choses font de sonic Adventure un très très bon jeu... Je ne vais évidement pas le juger sur ses graphismes (même si on parle de la version DX) car j'ai personnellement joué avec des mods me donnant l'expérience Sonic Adventure DreamCast. 
Mais j'ai sincèrement aimé "Rouler partout à la vitesse du son" avec Sonic ou Skip des pans de niveaux entier avec Tails ! 
Je pense même que je ne m'étais jamais autant amusé que faire l'histoire de Sonic et de Tails dans Sonic Adventure que dans n'importe qu'elle autres jeux Sonic, et je pense que c'est une expérience que tout fan de Sonic doit vivre une fois dans sa vie.


[h1] Mais, [b]C'ÉTAIT[/b] un super jeu... [/h1]
Car oui, je sais que ça parait logique, on parle d'un jeu de 98 sorti sur la Dreamcast tout de même... Mais, et c'est un gros mais... [b]LE. JEU. À. FAIT. SON. TEMPS. [/b]
Si vous vous contentez simplement de faire l'histoire de Sonic, Tails, Knuckles, voir Amy et E-101 Gamma alors la vous n'aurez aucun problèmes avec le jeu... Ces portions du jeu prouvent qu'il s'agit indéniablement de l'un si ce n'est le meilleur Sonic jamais créé.
Vous vous embêtez avec l'histoire de Big et là vous commencez à sentir la chose venir... Son gameplay est chiant, et souvent très incompréhensible (je ne compte pas le nombre de fois que j'ai ouvert des guides pour lui). Mais au moins vous pouvez faire la vraie fin avec Super Sonic qui est une bonne conclusion au jeu (même si j'ai des choses à redire dessus).

Vous vous embêtez à faire le 100% comme moi... Et vous comprenez que ce jeu à beaucoup trop mal vieilli...
À cause de bugs bien casse c***lles, si je puis me le permettre, mon 100% à été coupé de court puisque le jeu pense que je n'ai pas récupéré les 130 emblèmes, et pense aussi que je n'ai pas fini tout les niveaux (hors Metal Sonic) en défi A. Mais ça ce n'est qu'un détail qui me concerne moi et certains malchanceux...

Par contre... Les boss... On passe de l'Egg Viper qui est, je trouve, extrêmement dur, et puis d'un coup tout seul, tout les boss deviennent du pipi de chat ???? Les Chaos 2/4/6 sont une vaste blague en dehors de l'histoire de Sonic, les boss des autres protagonistes sont vachement underwhelming et faciles (vraiment j'ai first try quasiment tout mes boss finaux après celui de Sonic)... Et sérieux... Perfect Chaos... Si on enlève Open Your Heart le boss est trubo chiant... Une cutscene incroyablement longue et chiante avant, suivi d'un boss fight pas autant cinématique ou intéressant que d'autres et beaucoup trop court par rapport à la durée de la cinématique qui le précédait (je sais que je pouvais juste la skip, mais je l'ai regardé car ce serait de la mauvaise foi de ma part de juger le jeu sur ça alors que je ne l'aurais pas vu... Et je voulais comprendre l'histoire, accessoirement...) Je sais qu'on parle d'un jeu de 98, mais tout de même, je me suis fait royalement ch*** à juste avancer mon joystick vers l'avant et en le tournant à droite ou à gauche de temps en temps pour esquiver un caillou ou un siphon... Je me suis plus amusé à parler avec mon ami en même temps que sur le boss en lui même...

De plus... [b]MAIS LE 100%, C'EST UNE PURGE À S'EN TIRER LES CHEVEUX !!![/b]
Big à le gameplay le plus chiant de l'univers de Sonic, et je dirais même de tout jeu vidéos que j'ai jamais fait, tellement que j'ai utilisé un mod de tension illimité sur sa canne à pèche pour m'épargner les 7 heures de tryhard à pêcher des pu***ns poissons de 2 kilos. Les mini jeux de pèche, c'est pas si chiant habituellement, mais celui la était bien trop casse bonbons pour ce qye c'est !!!
La caméra est tellement mal foutue que je ne compte plus le nombre de speedruns pour le Niveau A que j'ai throw up en me jetant dans le vide avec Sonic, ou le nombre de sauts ratés avec Tails, ou même le nombre de fois que je ne voyais plus rien car ma caméra s'est dit que filmer en dehors de la salle ou je suis était une merveilleuse idée...
Et sérieusement... Le chaos Garden... MAIS QUI S'AMUSE DESSUS ????????
J'veux dire, le Chaos Garden très fun et mignong, je ne dis pas le contraire, mais j'ai passé 1/3 de mon temps de jeu total à faire des allés retours Marché Noir/Niveau/Bobby (mon chao du 100%) pour lui donner les fruits nécessaires pour qu'il puisse enfin battre les niveaux à emblèmes de la Chao race... 
[b] UNE PURGE JE VOUS DIT [/b]
Si on prend en compte le 100% complet de Sonic Adventure, ce dernier est pour moi bien loin de mériter son titre de l'un des meilleurs jeu Sonic de la license...


[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
Bon... Mon rant sur le 100% est enfin fini...
Et je peux conclure... Que le jeu est très bon.

Je sais que ça peut paraître idiot avec ce que je viens de dire sur le jeu, [b]MAIS[/b]... Il est très bon.
Il à certes super mal vieilli et n'est pas une partie de plaisir à 100%, voir n'est pas un plaisir du tout... Mais je comprend parfaitement pourquoi les fans le considère comme l'un des meilleurs Sonic de tout les temps... Mais pour moi cela ne peut pas s'appliquer à l'intégralité du jeu.
Le jeu est bon en surface, mais c'est quand tu veux plonger dedans que tu te rend compte de ses problèmes... C'est comme un gâteau à la m**de... Tu ne sais pas que s'en est un tant que tu ne l'a pas ouvert ou goûté... 

En bref ? Achetez le jeu, surtout si vous êtes fan de Sonic et que vous n'y avez jamais joué.
Ce jeu est une pépite et mérite d'être fini au moins une fois dans la vie de tout fan Sonic.
Mais pour moi, arrêtez vous à Super Sonic et le niveau C de chaque persos, sauf si vous êtes maso ou que vous avez un Mod Manager... Le 100% ne vaut pas absolument pas le temps qu'il vous faudra investir pour... C'est déjà mieux qu'un jeu à Patounnes (comme dirait JDG), c'est sûr, mais sincèrement, votre santé mentale et votre bureau vous remerciera si vous vous contentez de vous give les Achievements avec des Mods...

[h1] TL;DR [/h1]
Je ne recommande pas le jeu simplement car à mon avis, il ne vaut pas le coup dans son intégralité (100%), même avec BetterSADX (le mod le plus populaire pour améliorer votre expérience du jeu).
Mais si vous vous contentez de jouer au jeu pour finir les histoires de chaque perso une fois et faire Super Sonic, alors achetez le au plus vite !! 
Le fait que je ne le recommande pas est juste personnel.

184428696.review:
This was an important sonic game that you can tell paved the way for many to come.  It contained 6 stories and a final boss story which I will review individually because they vary in quality.  I generally liked the stages in this game, but not the adventure hubs.  These were super confusing to navigate.  
The Sonic story felt like a 3D sonic game.  It's what the series generally built off on.  It had some good and some bad levels.  7/10.
The Tails story was my favorite in this game.  The Tails levels had so many ways to shortcut even for a first playthrough.  My only problem is the levels were super short, so you were in the annoying hubs more than the awesome levels.  
8/10.
The Knuckles story had an interesting concept of having objectives hidden in random enemies and locations.  The Hot and Cold meter actually worked very well here, and it was overall very enjoyable.
7/10.
The Amy story is where things slow down.  Literally.  She's way slower than the other three and attacking while not at top speed on the ground halts all momentum.  The stages were average.
6/10.
The Big the Cat story is THE WORST THING EVER.  You will hate every second of your time playing this one.  The levels are comprised of fishing.  And the fishing minigame isn't even good.  Hold X, wait.  Hold X, wait.  And that's if you can get the frog to actually bite the hook.  Worst hour of this game, and the only reason its not a 1 or 2/10 is because its short.
3/10.
The E-102 story was fun.  You aren't super fast, but your attack doesn't hinder speed like in Amy's story, so it's fun to run through killing things.
7/10.
The final boss was pretty good.  It was clearly an important one.  I believe this was Super Sonic's first appearance so many of his mechanics were introduced such as being invincible but losing power as rings deplete over time.  It felt fast and fluid, but not necessarily epic.  I will cut them some slack here as future iterations of this concept needed something to build on. 
8/10.
The music was good but there wasn't enough of it.  It felt repetitive by the end.
7/10.
This game will not change your view of Sonic.  I recommend this game if you like Sonic.  I don't recommend this game if you don't like Sonic.
Overall this is a 7/10 game.

The actual start of the 3D Sonic era.

I never played this game when I was younger, but I heard numerous times that this was the definitive 3D Sonic game. However, this is just not true, Yes there are some positive moments in the game, but they are equal with the negatives. Playing separate story lines one at a time is annoying and was refined to a better system in Sonic Adventure 2. Even though this game has a better mission design for the various characters than SA2, I personally like the more cohesive story telling and progression that is available in the sequel.

From what I have seen, the optimal way to play this game is with a mod called Better SADX. It provides improved lighting and a variety of other features that make the game closer to the original Dream Cast release of the game.

Even without this mod, I believe the game is worth playing. There is some jank due to the age of the game, but it is a fun time that is accesible.

184311217.review:
First off, awful port. If you plan on playing, before you do anything install SADX modloader and install all the recommended dreamcast conversion mods.

Port aside, Sonic Adventure is a classic, and having played it in the modern era with no nostalgia bias, I can say I still enjoyed it. That being said, it's age CERTAINLY shows, and it simply does not stack up to a lot of modern games. The controls are tight if overly finicky in some running sections. The levels are very fun, well designed and usually a blast to play through. The bosses are meh, nothing to write home about aside from one really annoying one. The biggest flaw by far is the CAMERA. It's bad. It doesn't matter how good the controls are if you can't see where you're running, and I found that to be a fairly common issue. 

In terms of story, adventure is certainly ambitious but I can't say it's anything great. The way that each character experiences it from their own perspective is COOL, but not very substantial. But the story at it's core is fairly bland and formulaic. Just enough to be fun. 

I'd give it a SOLID 7.5/10. Though I'm sure if I was a kid who got this game for Christmas I would think it's the best thing ever.

184156187.review:
Oh, wow, um, okay—Sonic the Hedgehog (2006), or as some fans like to call it, "Sonic '06," what a game... honestly, it’s hard to describe it without feeling like… uh, like, you know, when you're just on the edge of something really good, but you can’t quite reach it, you know? Anyway, let's talk about this experience for a moment.

So, first off, the gameplay. The controls—uh, they can feel, well, a little stiff. A bit rough around the edges, if you catch my drift… but ugh, when you hit that sweet spot, when the gameplay flows just right—oh, wow, it feels almost like… like a deep sigh of relief, but—uh, no, no, I mean, I’m fine! It's fine! We’re just talking about the game! Ahem.

Sonic '06 is a… um, how do I say it, it’s a beautiful mess? It’s like—oh, gosh, it’s like everything is in motion, but nothing feels entirely right? Still, the game has a certain charm, especially when you finally get to play as the amazing Rouge the Bat—ugh, man, don’t even get me started on her. Rouge—she’s everything. You know, it's like, the moment she enters the scene, I just… well, I get kind of distracted. I mean, she’s like this perfect blend of confidence and sass, and her design—those purple hues? The way her wings and her attitude are both, like, so sharp and graceful? Ugh… ugh... okay, back to the review.

Sonic's gameplay? Eh, it’s a mixed bag. Sometimes the physics feel like you’re being dragged through molasses, but then—and here’s the kicker—sometimes it clicks. Oh, and the level design—don't get me started on some of the epic stages where you’re speeding through gorgeous vistas. Oh man… I’m getting a bit too worked up here. Ahem. It’s definitely got potential, but it’s like, um, too many things at once? You know? And, uh, it just leaves you—ergh—just on the verge of an emotional release. But... but it’s fine. I’m fine. It’s just... it’s just a game.

Uh, where was I? Right, right, so the story—it’s a bit… convoluted, right? Time travel, alternate dimensions, love interests, and—oh! And did I mention Rouge the Bat? I think I did, but I could go on forever about her—her mysteriousness… she’s not your typical hero, she’s a femme fatale, but she’s got such a deep inner strength. You know, it’s like when she’s in those cutscenes, I feel like, oh man, I’m getting really into it, but I’ll just, you know, focus on the game right now. Focus on Sonic, yeah.

Um… the graphics—well, for 2006, it’s, uh, ambitious, but some textures just don’t hold up. The animation can be a bit janky, and the frame rate... it’s like, it’s trying, you know? It’s trying to be good, but it’s just kind of... falling short. But sometimes—sometimes—you get these little moments where everything clicks, and you just feel... um, like everything is in harmony, right? But I’m not saying it's perfect, obviously, it’s just—uh, yeah. Just a little bit of bliss that feels... so close... but not quite there. Not quite.

And oh! Oh! The music—let’s talk about the music! It's catchy and memorable, especially that "His World" track, which I can’t get out of my head, even though, uh, I probably should be focusing on the actual game, right? But it just gets stuck in your head, you know? Like Rouge. She is always stuck in my mind.

sigh... so... yeah, what was I talking about? Right! The game! It's, um, really rough but there are moments that feel almost perfect, but I can’t—can’t quite explain why… oh my god, Rouge. She’s like… everything, okay? I just—I’m so passionate about her, it’s like I can’t—ugh, I don’t know how to explain it! But Sonic '06, man, if you can look past the glitches and weirdness, you might find yourself—just… lost in this strange, messy world. But not as lost as I am when Rouge appears on screen. She’s... ugh, she’s just so much.

Overall: Sonic the Hedgehog (2006) is a rollercoaster of highs and lows, but don’t let its flaws fool you—it still has that raw energy, that potential, and oh—did I mention Rouge? Because I just can’t stop thinking about her. Just... perfect. Absolutely perfect.

8/10—but, honestly, it's probably a 10/10 if Rouge was in it more.

183899217.review:
[h2]Zacznę od kwestii samej gry, a potem powiem o jakości tego portu, bo jest co mówić.[/h2]

[h1]Fabuła[/h1]

[h3]Opowieść[/h3]
Opowieść jest nijaka. Przez pierwsze 4 godziny jakoś ją śledziłem, ale z czasem przestała mnie interesować. Jest pretekstowa, jak na platformówkę przystało, i kiczowata.

[h3]Cutscenki[/h3]
Przerywniki filmowe są nijakie. Drewniane animacje postaci odbierają przyjemność z oglądania ich. Nie jest to kwestia wieku gry, ale wykonania, np. Rayman w "Rayman 2" jest o wiele lepiej animowany.
Gra aktorów jest jeszcze gorsza. Miałem wrażenie, że nie tylko aktorzy nie znają kontekstu, ale i nagrywali wszystkie dialogi na jedną próbę.

[h1]Rozgrywka[/h1]
Gra składa się z 7 kampanii. Siódmą odblokowuje się, przechodząc 6 poprzednich.

[h3]Otwarte segmenty[/h3]
Podczas przechodzenia wszystkich kampanii można pozwiedzać różne lokacje, które pełnią funkcję swego rodzaju huba. Tu akurat kwestia gustu. Mi się to nie podobało i mogłoby tego nie być, bo w zasadzie nic do rozgrywki nie dodaje i niepotrzebnie wydłuża grę.

[h3]Sonic[/h3]
Najdłuższa i najlepsza według mnie kampania. Niebieskim jeżem steruje się miło, a jego fizyka pozwala na zabawę z jego wachlarzem ruchów.
Poziomy są dobrze zaprojektowane, a speedrunowanie ich jest najbardziej zabawne.

[h3]Tails[/h3]
Kampania Tailsa to powtórka z kampanii Sonica. Steruje się nim w porządku.
Poruszamy się po tych samych poziomach co Sonic, ale dzięki umiejętnościom Tailsa możemy w odpowiedni sposób pominąć spore fragmenty.

[h3]Knuckles[/h3]
Jego poziomy to eksploracja z radarem do znajdowania fragmentów emeraldów.
Sterowanie jest w miarę kompetentne, ale według mnie cierpi z powodu przypisania wszystkiego tylko do 2 przycisków.

[h3]Amy[/h3]
Nie jest ani trochę szybka jak jej koledzy. Jej gameplay przypomina biedną wersję Super Mario 64, ale z mniejszym wachlarzem ruchów.
W poziomach z Amy mamy trochę do czynienia z zagadkami, które są dziecinnie proste i wątpię, by komuś sprawiły problem.

[h3]Robot "γ"[/h3]
Przejście tej kampanii jest bardzo proste. W poziomach głównie strzelamy do przeciwników i idziemy przed siebie. Nic specjalnego i całe szczęście nie jest długie. Sterowanie jest moim zdaniem w porządku.

[h3]Big the Cat[/h3]
Najgorsza kampania ze wszystkich. Nie wiem, kto pomyślał, że łowienie będzie pasować do platformówki z Sonikiem. Serio? Dodatkowo mechanika łowienia jest nieintuicyjna. Kampania niby na 30 minut, ale spędzisz 2 godziny, bo ta cholerna żaba nie chce się złapać. Nie byłoby problemu, gdyby to było opcjonalne, ale to [b]trzeba przejść, aby odblokować ostatnią kampanię.[/b]

[h1]Kwestie techniczne[/h1]
Warto powiedzieć, że jest to zły port. Wizualnie ta wersja gry według mnie prezentuje się gorzej od wersji na Dreamcasta. Zwłaszcza jeżeli chodzi o oświetlenie, które jest ubogie w porównaniu z oryginałem. Postacie przez swoje tekstury wyglądają plastikowo, a przy drewnianych animacjach, które są dodatkowo źle zsynchronizowane, wygląda to tragicznie. Nie obyło się też bez gliczy [i](+ czasami kamera szaleje)[/i].
Oczywiście lepiej grać w to na padzie, jeżeli nie chcecie rzucić tej gry w cholerę.
Na koniec wspomnę, że gra nawet nie ma wsparcia proporcji 16:9, a w opcjach nawet nie ma możliwości dostosowania dystansu renderowania obiektów.
Na szczęście da się część tych wad naprawić modami. Nie bądźcie jak ja i grajcie w to na modach, by mieć lepsze doświadczenie z tej gry.

[h1]Podsumowanie[/h1]
Dobra gra mimo wad, zły port.
Dla fanów platformówek 3D fajna rzecz.
Bez modów nie tykać.
[i]Szczęść Boże.[/i]

183794224.review:
I have played this game many times as a kid, over many years and I've owned it on different systems, so I do have a soft spot for it and can only rate it positively, but if you've never experienced this game before, it is very old and dated and it shows in every corner. You might not like it because of all its flaws, seen from current standards, but at its time, it was an amazing experience!

This port is just that, a port. It doesn't come with any optimiziations, no nothing. As other reviews are rightfully pointing out, this game needs mods to look good and support 16:9 aspect ratios etc.
If you're willing to do a bit of tinkering, you're gonna enjoy this game a lot more.

Anyway, to the game itself!

It is the first main Sonic title in 3D, which shows in the wonky graphics the characters are doing, but it has its charme!
The stagedesign and controls are not perfect by any means. It IS outdated after all and I personally very much prefer todays standard boost gameplay, BUT it is still fun!

If you're willing to look past all the wonky stuff, you've got a great game at hands!
I like the story, it makes perfect sense in Sonics universe and the stages are fun to play through.

The controls are a little too floaty, though if you spindash and jump, you can shoot yourself quite far. Chaining spindashes together also makes you really go very fast! Not as consistent as the boostgameplay does, but it does feel a lot more skillbased, instead of just pressing a single button.

You play as 6 different characters: Sonic, Tails, Knuckles, Amy, Big and Gamma.
All in a overworld linking everything together. It can be pretty confusing where to go sometimes and you'll definitely get lost in the jungle a few times. 😂

Sonic is your typical fast Sonic gameplay. Running, jumping, spindashing, its what is most fun to me in the entire game, but aside from Bigs fishing controls, they all don't feel too bad to control.

Tails is mostly the same, but you can fly aswell and reach other paths and places. Nothing that different, still nice gameplay.

Knuckles stages consist of searching for pieces of the master emerald thats been broken, so his levels are designed much different, you're basically searching these pieces in one big sandbox.
Aside from digging for stuff, he can glide and climb walls, the typical knuckles experience!

Amy is very slow and uses a hammer. She constantly has to flee from some robot, it is pretty annoying, mostly because of how slow she is, but she can jump higher with her hammer. Gameplay is fine, though more boring than the other 3.

Gamma is basically a shoot em up type of gameplay, but as a platformer. You walk around, shoot stuff and do a bit of platforming. Nothing too bad, nothing too amazing, it is more content, but it fits into the story!

Big is just doing his own thing... fishing. You go from water to water, trying to fish for froggy. The fishing controls are very unintuitive, I can't even remember how they work exactly, best to check a quick guide or tutorial before playing it for them. Once you know how it works, it gets pretty easy, but as long as you don't understand, you'll by ripping your hairs out! 😅
I like him though, meme material.

Overall I really want people to experience this game and because I always really liked it, I can't ever rate it negatively.
But definitely be warned, that it isn't exactly a polished experience compared to newer games!

183715155.review:
*Sonic Adventure* isn’t just a game—it’s an experience. It’s the moment Sonic went 3D and actually made it work, but more than that, it told a story that felt bigger than anything the series had done before. Yeah, some parts are a little clunky now, but the heart of the game and its themes still hold up.  

The story is surprisingly layered, especially for a game that could’ve just been about running fast and collecting rings. At the center of it is Chaos, this ancient water creature that’s way more than just a boss. He’s not evil—he’s a victim. The game makes it clear that Chaos is acting out of pain and anger because of what happened to his home, the Chao, and Tikal, who tried to protect them. It’s not often you get a villain in a Sonic game with this much depth, but Chaos isn’t even really a villain. He’s just broken, and that makes him way more interesting.  

Each character’s story adds to the bigger picture, too. Sonic’s the usual hero, saving the day with his speed and confidence, but even he has moments where he stops to reflect on what’s happening. Tails’ story is all about stepping out of Sonic’s shadow and proving he can be a hero on his own, which is honestly really inspiring. Knuckles is focused on his duty to protect the Master Emerald, but through him, you also get the history of the Echidna tribe and how their greed caused Chaos’ rage in the first place.  

Even the smaller stories matter. Amy’s arc is about finding her own strength and standing up for herself. E-102 Gamma’s story, though, is probably the most emotional part of the whole game. It’s about breaking free from control and doing the right thing, even when it means sacrificing yourself. The way Gamma turns on Eggman and ultimately saves the other robots is unexpectedly tragic and beautiful.  

The themes of *Sonic Adventure* are what make it stand out. It’s about balance—between progress and nature, between duty and freedom, between revenge and forgiveness. The whole thing with Chaos is a warning about what happens when greed and violence take over, but it’s also a message of hope. Chaos’ rage is finally calmed not by a big battle (though there is one, and it’s epic) but by the Chao showing him that not everything is lost. The ending, where Chaos and Tikal return to rest peacefully, feels like the perfect conclusion.  

The game’s world adds so much to the story, too. You’re not just running through random zones—you’re exploring places like the Mystic Ruins, Station Square, and the Egg Carrier, all of which feel connected to the story. The ancient ruins and flashbacks to the Echidna tribe give the game this sense of history that makes everything feel bigger.  

Sure, the gameplay can be a little rough at times (Big the Cat, anyone?), but the story makes up for it. *Sonic Adventure* wasn’t just a leap into 3D—it was Sonic trying to tell a deeper, more meaningful story, and it absolutely delivered. It’s a game about learning from the past, finding your own strength, and making peace with what’s been lost. It’s not perfect, but it’s bold, emotional, and unforgettable. That’s why it’s still one of the greatest Sonic games ever made.

183655215.review:
Отличная игра из детства, которая удачно перешла из 2D в 3D платформу, и спустя много лет захотелось заново пройти. Сразу напишу, что играл только в модифицированную версию BetterSADX Mod с Dreamcast-контентом и улучшенной графикой. Поэтому лучше сразу начинать именно с неё, т.к. оригинальный порт не очень. Никогда не доводилось пройти её на 100%, решил, что это время настало.

Интересный геймплей за шесть различных персонажей, где у каждого сюжет интересно пересекается, но в целом вся история не очень — что в играх про Соника норма. Интересно пробегать уровни за Соника, Наклза, Гамму, Эми. Уровни Тейлза слишком короткие, если правильно понять, как летать, но за Бига скучновато, особенно если выполнять все задания. Есть небольшой открытый мир, что прикольно. На некоторых уровнях понравились саундтреки.

Если говорить про 100% прохождение, есть много разнообразных мини-игр, уровней и заданий, которые в целом не дают заскучать. Некоторые уровни слишком простые, и такое чувство, что разработчики не были готовы к некоторым фичам. Например, если делать быстрый Spin Dash с прыжком за Соника, это позволяет сокращать большую часть уровня. Есть пара неприятных миссий, с которыми придётся попотеть, подобрать тайминг и так далее. Есть интересная механика с ухаживанием за Чао — что-то в духе Тамагочи в мире Соника. Но чтобы получить эмблемы за чао-гонки, придётся гриндить, что надоедает. Сами гонки частично рандомные: может не повезти в некоторых моментах, где чао друг друга блокируют, либо ваш чао перед финишем уснёт, а другой ускорится. Всё это заставляло всё больше гоняться по уровням и собирать этих животных либо кольца, чтобы купить вещи в магазине. Эмблемы за титры, где нужно 7 раз до конца посмотреть, кто приложил усилия к этой чудесной игре, — каждый игрок должен знать этих героев. Доп. персонаж, который появляется после 130 эмблем, — это просто другая моделька с копиями уровней за Соника. Хотелось бы хотя бы редизайна или усложнённых миссий.

Самый главный противник, с которым сражается игрок, — это камера. Чуть поспешишь или в некоторых моментах неправильно пропрыгаешь, камера за тобой не успевает и начинает показывать неудобный ракурс. Есть моменты, где можно улететь за карту, если слишком быстро пробегать за Соника. В общем, при спешке эту игру легко сломать.

В целом пробежал игру с удовольствием.

183522509.review:
Finalmente tive a oportunidade de jogar e zerar esse game por completo, eu gostei muito dele, por mais que tenha muitos bugs e erros, pra época em que ele lançou foi algo que revolucionou a franquia Sonic. Esse game é dividido por 5 campanhas principais [spoiler] (e uma secreta). [/spoiler]

[b] Sonic: [/b] Gameplay do Sonic se mantém como o padrão, fases rápidas, radicais, e com momentos épicos e divertidos.

[b] Tails: [/b] A do Tails achei interessante ter uma pegada mais de corrida, acho que de certa maneira combinou com ele, pelo fato de você poder voar pelo cenário e ainda ser uma gameplay diferente pro Tails, não sendo só voltado a ele usando invenções dele ou ele com avião coisas do tipo.

Knuckles: Gosto da gameplay do Knuckles (por mais difícil que eu apanhe muito pra achar as esmeraldas no SA2 kkkkkkkkk), e de como o jogo deixa de certa maneira "fácil" e mais dinâmico você achar as peças. É um estilo divertido que faz você explorar cada canto do cenário.

[b] Amy: [/b] É interessante ter ela jogável nesse game, deram um destaque até que maneirinho pra ela e a história da campanha é até que legal, [spoiler] mas cara, que agonia jogar com a Amy sendo perseguida por todas as fases, dá um desconforto do caralho aquele robô seguindo, eu nunca foi perseguido (eu acho), mas esse robô me mostrou como deve ser kkkkkkkkkk. [/spoiler]

[b] Big: [/b] É muito frustrante jogar com o Big, ainda mais que o jogo não te explica como funciona a gameplay dele. A frase "tá nervoso, vai pescar" não se aplica nessa porra não kkkkkkkkkkkkkk. Mas até que de certa maneira a história dele serviu pra outro jogo. [spoiler] (Sonic Heroes, mas isso não vem ao caso agora) [/spoiler]

[b] E-102 Gamma: [/b] Fiquei muito curioso no começo sobre como seria, a campanha não dava nada, mas entregou tudo, simplesmente foi maneiro e bem legal (principalmente o final dela), mesmo que foi algo rápido é um conteúdo a mais que foi bom de ter.

[spoiler] [b] Super Sonic: [/b] Simplesmente foda é muito gratificante jogar de super Sonic ainda mais tocando Open Your Heart de fundo, final foda demais que faz esse jogo ser muito memorável, tanto a história da Tikal com o Chaos terminarem bem (inclusive seria bom ter eles de volta em algum futuro game), sem palavras pra esse final. [/spoiler]

Em geral, esse jogo tem problemas que podem atrapalhar hoje em dia, em quesito de só deixar o jogador sem saber oque fazer pelo cenário (inclusive isso tem direto e eu empaquei algumas vezes na hora de progredir), alguns cenários serem desproporcionais e você ter que dar um pulinho pra continuar andando, mas continua sendo um jogo muito bom com uma trilha sonora magnífica que até hoje tem músicas muito famosas, acho engraçado as expressões dos personagens em alguns momentos, tanto que recentemente virou meme kkkkkk. Esse jogo é ótimo e agora que finalmente zerei, tenho certeza que é muito bom, peguei um carinho por ele.

[b] Nota: [/b] 8

Finalmente, bora pro Sonic Adventure 2.
